subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Marcos Ambrose took advantage of a pit stop midway through the Nationwide Zippo 200 at Watkins Glen, N.Y., and easily beat Kyle Busch for his first career Nascar victory. Ambrose was in the pits on the 42nd lap when the fourth caution of the 82-lap race flew. He gained the lead on the 48th lap, then gave it up to pit for fuel. Ambrose worked his way to third place with 12 laps to go while Jeff Burton and Jimmie Johnson battled for the lead. But they ran out of fuel with three laps left. Matt Kenseth took third.
